reviews.text: The Cypress hotel is an old style hotel converted for conference and meeting facilities. I was very aprehensive as have mainly stayed in down town - Sheraton or Marriot hotels in China. This was a welcome surprise with deluxe rooms giving a large queen bed, sitting area, desk, dressing area and bathroom. The staff understood basic English and were very helpful; I would not recommend the European food (not good!) but dine in the Jasmine restaurant - great Chinese food at fair prices.
reviews.title: Deluxe rooms offer comfort and space in Shanghai
Only if you're stuck
reviews.text: OK hotel in a middle class suburb of Shanghai...

My company often puts us up at this hotel, since it's near the airport and our office, but those are really the only two advantages of the place. The rooms are only average, the food is poor, the location is awful (it's nowhere near anything, so you have to take a cab to go to meals), and the service is rock bottom. And the gym is awful. And most of the restaurants are never open.
reviews.title: Nohting fancy
Give it a miss unless a budget is limited
reviews.text: Overall hotel stay was just OK. Reception area speaks decent English, beds are small, tap water is not drinkable, restaurants are not great, but the garden area would be nice in the summer.
